newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak Nafta, VSZ pull SAX index lower.
newsitem.headline: Slovak Nafta, VSZ pull SAX index lower.

text.p: Leading Slovak shares closed mixed in dull trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange on Wednesday, but losses to its most-capitalised issues pulled the 12-share SAX index 1.3 points down to 213.97.

The index's most-capitalised issue, crude oil refiner Slovnaft did not trade, while Nafta gas storage, and steel maker VSZ lost ground. Nafta, leading acitivity on the floor with 10,008 shares traded, closed down 20 crowns at 2,000.
"It could be foreign investors selling their shares in Nafta due to recent events... the price is low for such volume," said Patrik Granec of Slovenska Sporitelna.

Earlier in August, the Slovak state privatisation agency the National Property Fund sold its 45.9 percent stake in Nafta, worth more than three billion crowns, for a mere 500 million crowns to an anonymous domestic firm.
Brokers said foreign investors currently hold about 20-30 percent of Nafta's shares.
VSZ closed down eight crowns at 642, with mere 105 shares traded.
"VSZ is fundamentally good as Slovakia's key company, but it's price appears to be held up in the 600-700 crown range against the market sentiment," Granec said.
Overall volume dropped to 92,569 shares traded from 347,526 shares on Tuesday, as turnover fell to 83.99 million crowns from 282.68 million.
